plan: In the initial rounds, I'll test aggressive bids slightly above my value to gather data on opponents' bidding patterns. If my value is high (above 30), I'll bid close to $40 to maximize winning chances. For moderate values (15-30), I'll bid around 70-80% of my value to balance risk and reward. For low values (below 15), I'll bid conservatively around 50% to minimize losses. I'll adjust based on observed patterns, like if opponents consistently bid high or low, to refine my strategy in later rounds for optimal profit maximization.

To maximize long-term profit, I will adopt a mixed bidding strategy. Initially, I will bid conservatively, slightly below my value, to gauge competitors' tendencies. In subsequent rounds, I will occasionally place aggressive bids above my value to test if others are risk-averse. If competitors consistently bid high, I will employ a "shadow bid" strategy, bidding just below my value to secure wins without overpaying. I will also experiment with low bids when my value is low to gather data on others' behaviors. This adaptive approach will help optimize my bids based on observed patterns and competitors' strategies.

To maximize long-term profit, I'll employ a mix of strategies. Initially, I'll test aggressive bids slightly above my value to gauge competitors' behavior. I'll also try conservative bids just below my value to see if I can win cheaply. Midway, I'll experiment with random bids to gather data on others' patterns. I'll adjust based on observed trends, such as consistently high bids from others. In the final rounds, I'll leverage insights gained to strategically bid slightly above competitors' likely bids, ensuring a win while minimizing costs. This adaptive approach balances risk and learning for optimal profit.

Next, I'll bid 90% of my value if it's above 25, aiming to win with a margin. For values 15-25, I'll bid 70% to stay competitive. Below 15, I'll bid 40% to minimize potential losses. Adjust based on competitors' bids to refine strategy.
